experience.title: Product and Cloud Lead - Data & AI team
experience.description: Since January 2024, I have been at the helm of managing, designing, and implementing AI-focused, cloud-based solutions, including Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and integration of Large Language Models (LLMs), as a leader within PwC Portugal's Data & AI team. Our aim is to deliver top-tier AI-powered products, striking a balance between pro-code and low-code methodologies, and leveraging cloud-based deployment for scalability. I lead a team of experts, setting architectural standards and leading the orchestration of AI automation workflows. My proficiency in Microsoft Azure and Power Platform is crucial for advancing these solutions from concept to worldwide implementation.

experience.title: Cloud and Business Apps Lead - Consulting Solutions team
experience.description: As the Cloud and Business Apps Consulting Lead, I design cutting-edge cloud architectures, having contributed to over 90 opportunities for global partners and clients. I manage a team of specialized technical consultants within a Consulting Solutions team of about 80 professionals.

experience.title: Specialist - Consulting Solutions team
experience.description: As a Microsoft Power Platform specialist, I utilize the full suite of Power Platform tools, from Canvas Apps and Power BI reports to Power Portals/Pages and Chatbots (Virtual Agents/Copilot Studio). I integrated these solutions with Azure (e.g., Functions, Logic Apps, Data Factory & Data Lake Gen2), Microsoft 365 (e.g Teams, Outlook), Dynamics 365, SQL Server, Dataverse, and SharePoint services. In addition to this expertise, I've successfully led full-stack pro-code app development projects, overseeing them from concept to delivery. Notably, I also earned PwC Portugal's first ever Hackathon as the team leader and technical specialist. This initiative has evolved into a product that we are now beginning to sell worldwide.

experience.title: The Career Exploration Years
experience.description: Survived a whirlwind tour through Portugal's service economy - from cold-calling as a telemarketer (REDITUS), folding clothes with surgical precision (ZARA), explaining why wasabi isn't guacamole (Yo! Sushi), and selling suspiciously overpriced hot dogs. Worked in a university call center answering frantic students' questions about campus locations, created marketing materials nobody read at Le Wagon, and participated in organizing festivals and publicity campaigns for Sagres, but ended up doing powerpoints about lemon beer packaging. A character-building odyssey that taught me patience, resilience, and how to smile while a tourist explains that in Portugal it's called a 'galão' not a 'meia de leite'.
